Address:   192.168.1.64          11000000.10101000.00000001.0100 0000
Netmask:   255.255.255.240 = 28  11111111.11111111.11111111.1111 0000
Wildcard:  0.0.0.15              00000000.00000000.00000000.0000 1111
=>
Network:   192.168.1.64/28       11000000.10101000.00000001.0100 0000 (Class C)
Broadcast: 192.168.1.79          11000000.10101000.00000001.0100 1111
HostMin:   192.168.1.65          11000000.10101000.00000001.0100 0001
HostMax:   192.168.1.78          11000000.10101000.00000001.0100 1110
Hosts/Net: 14                    (Private Internet)


Que:

Split 192.168.1.64 / 28 into two smaller subnets of /29 

Netmask of /29 255.255.255.248  11111111.11111111.11111111.1111 1000
So, Address:   192.168.1.64          11000000.10101000.00000001.0100 0000  is one of the /29

And the other being
Netmask of /29 255.255.255.248  11111111.11111111.11111111.1111 1000
So, Address:   192.168.1.72         11000000.10101000.00000001.0100 1000  is one of the /29
